segment.source: Applying Filters to Data in the SUA Tool (Windows 10)
segment.target: Applying Filters to Data in the SUA Tool (Windows 10)

segment.source: On the user interface for the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can apply filters to the issues that the tool has found so that you can view only the information that interests you.
segment.target: On the user interface for the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can apply filters to the issues that the tool has found so that you can view only the information that interests you.

segment.source: Applying Filters to Data in the SUA Tool
segment.target: Applying Filters to Data in the SUA Tool

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: On the user interface for the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can apply filters to the issues that the tool has found so that you can view only the information that interests you.
segment.target: On the user interface for the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can apply filters to the issues that the tool has found so that you can view only the information that interests you.

segment.source: To apply filters to data in the SUA tool
segment.target: To apply filters to data in the SUA tool

segment.source: Use the SUA tool to test an application.
segment.target: Use the SUA tool to test an application.

segment.source: For more information, see Using the SUA Tool.
segment.target: For more information, see Using the SUA Tool.

segment.source: After you finish testing, in the SUA tool, click a tab that shows issues that the SUA tool has found.
segment.target: After you finish testing, in the SUA tool, click a tab that shows issues that the SUA tool has found.

segment.source: All tabs except the App Info tab can show issues.
segment.target: All tabs except the App Info tab can show issues.

segment.source: On the Options menu, click a command that corresponds to the filter that you want to apply.
segment.target: On the Options menu, click a command that corresponds to the filter that you want to apply.

segment.source: The following table describes the commands.
segment.target: The following table describes the commands.

segment.source: Options menu command
segment.target: Options menu command

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Filter Noise
segment.target: Filter Noise

segment.source: Filters noise from the issues.
segment.target: Filters noise from the issues.

segment.source: This command is selected by default.
segment.target: This command is selected by default.

segment.source: Load Noise Filter File
segment.target: Load Noise Filter File

segment.source: Opens the Open Noise Filter File dialog box, in which you can load an existing noise filter (.xml) file.
segment.target: Opens the Open Noise Filter File dialog box, in which you can load an existing noise filter (.xml) file.

segment.source: Export Noise Filter File
segment.target: Export Noise Filter File

segment.source: Opens the Save Noise Filter File dialog box, in which you can save filter settings as a noise filter (.xml) file.
segment.target: Opens the Save Noise Filter File dialog box, in which you can save filter settings as a noise filter (.xml) file.

segment.source: Only Display Records with Application Name in StackTrace
segment.target: Only Display Records with Application Name in StackTrace

segment.source: Filters out records that do not have the application name in the stack trace.
segment.target: Filters out records that do not have the application name in the stack trace.

segment.source: However, because the SUA tool captures only the first 32 stack frames, this command can also filter out real issues with the application where the call stack is deeper than 32 frames.
segment.target: However, because the SUA tool captures only the first 32 stack frames, this command can also filter out real issues with the application where the call stack is deeper than 32 frames.

segment.source: Show More Details in StackTrace
segment.target: Show More Details in StackTrace

segment.source: Shows additional stack frames that are related to the SUA tool, but not related to the diagnosed application.
segment.target: Shows additional stack frames that are related to the SUA tool, but not related to the diagnosed application.

segment.source: Warn Before Deleting AppVerifier Logs
segment.target: Warn Before Deleting AppVerifier Logs

segment.source: Displays a warning message before the SUA tool deletes all of the existing SUA-related log files on the computer.
segment.target: Displays a warning message before the SUA tool deletes all of the existing SUA-related log files on the computer.

segment.source: This command is selected by default.
segment.target: This command is selected by default.

segment.source: Logging
segment.target: Logging

segment.source: Provides the following logging-related options:
segment.target: Provides the following logging-related options:

segment.source: Show or hide log errors.
segment.target: Show or hide log errors.

segment.source: Show or hide log warnings.
segment.target: Show or hide log warnings.

segment.source: Show or hide log information.
segment.target: Show or hide log information.

segment.source: To maintain a manageable file size, we recommend that you do not select the option to show informational messages.
segment.target: To maintain a manageable file size, we recommend that you do not select the option to show informational messages.
